posts.message: Functional Programming and Thinking in Types in Haskell Online Course
posts.caption: Functional Programming and Thinking in Types in Haskell Course
posts.description:
About the course : 
===============
This is a tailored course for developers who want to get their brains around the Functional Programming Paradigm, how to think functionally and what do you need to break the barriers and become a functional programmers, what are the benefits and how will this affect you even if you stick to your imperative language. The course will focus on the Haskell programming language but just as an illustration language, the concepts and ideas demonstrated in this course are the same in most languages and the lessons you will learn during this course will affect the way your brain work and eventually will make you a better and more conscious programmer.

We will cover the basics of Haskell programming language and eventually you will be able to understand the meaning of those words properly: Types, Type Variables, Monads, Type Classes, Value Types, Kinds, Applicatives, Functors, Pure Functions, Recursion, Tail Recursion Optimisation, Pattern Matching, Set/List Comprehensions, Currying, Algebraic Types.

If you are a life-long imperative programmer (Java, C, and etc.) you will enjoy this brain wrestling and I will challenge you to change the way your brain works.

The course is totally free, and will be delivered online.

About the instructor :
================
Ahmed Soliman is an entrepreneur, software and systems architect coming from a diverse background of highly scalable applications design, mission-critical systems, asynchronous data analytics, social networks design, reactive distributed systems, and systems administration and engineering. He also published a US technology patent in distributed computer-based virtual laboratories and designed numerous large-scale distributed systems for massive-scale enterprise customers.

A software engineer at heart, he is experienced in over 10 programming languages, but most recently, he is busy designing and writing applications in Python, Ruby, and Scala for several customers. He is also an open source evangelist and activist. He co-founded CAT Reloaded students community and Nozom NGO.

Ahmed is a co-founder of Cloud Niners Ltd., a software and services venture focused on highly scalable cloud-based applications that have been delivering private and public cloud computing services to customers in the MEA region on different platforms and technologies. It’s the company behind TeeksForGeeks.com, SimTry.com, J25 Framework, Redique, and etc.

He is the author of [Packt Publishing] Getting Started With Memcached book (http://amzn.to/1gbh1T8) and the primary reviewer of [Packt Publishing] Python Network Programming Cookbook (http://amzn.to/1iTrrBC)

How to attend ? 
=============
1- Register NOW : http://bit.ly/HaskellCourse
2- Get the confirmation mail.
3- Follow any new updates posted in the event page.

posts.message:
السلام عليكم, مايكروسوفت أصدرت فى شهر فبراير اللى فات إضافه للفيجوال ستوديو 2013 أكثر من رائعه وهى : 
# Bing Code Search for C 
بإختصار دى إضافه بتخليك تعمل بحث عن حلول للمشاكل الشائعه وانت شغال جوه الفيجوال ستوديو, وبتجيلك نتائج البحث على شكل فقرات كود جاهزه للإستخدام (Snippets).
هم حالياً شغالين مع كذا موقع من ضمنهم طبعاً MSDN و StackOverflow واتنين كمان.
دا رابط للإضافه هتلاقي معاه شرح بسيط لكيفية إستعمالها: http://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/a1166718-a2d9-4a48-a5fd-504ff4ad1b65

ودا فيديو بيشرح إستخدام الإضافه بشكل عملى: http://research.microsoft.com/apps/video/default.aspx?id=208961&r=1

إستمتعوا :)
posts.caption: visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com
posts.description: This package allows you to search for snippets from the cloud and inserts them into your code without leaving Visual Studio.

posts.message: Watch the video, Apple vs PC, Surface Pro 3 version (by Yahoo)
posts.caption: yahoo.com
posts.description: Yes, here is Microsoft again, with a third version of its Surface Pro; The Surface concept is either brilliant or doomed: It’s a tablet and a laptop in one. When it’s a tablet, it’s something like an iPad. It can run the 4 million Windows programs — full-blown software like Photoshop, Quicken, iTune…
